 Chesterfield (modified)

| [Screen shot 2015-02-12 at 1.43.41 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114954/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202015-02-12%20at%201.43.41%20PM.png) | 39.68 KB |
author: Smartprint

comments.content: It could be a manually compressed & modified **[Chesterfield](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114954/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Chesterfield%20LT%20Std%20-%20Regular&fid=6e4840255689a284e700a8564f079625&fsize=60&text=FOUNDATION&fit=1)** (main differences being |T| & |F|)

Chesterfield was designed by Alan Meeks for Letraset in 1977. The glyphs in the digital Chesterfield, including \_T\_ and \_F\_, seem to match the original, as shown in my Letraset product catalog from 1985.  
Chesterfield was also digitizatized by Uwe Borchert as Mops Antiqua (Pug Serif) [http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-56498.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114954/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-56498.html "http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-56498.html") It does not have the modified \_T\_ and \_F\_. So I agree with Fivos that the letters in\_FOUNDATION\_ are customized.  
Don
Wow! Thank you so much guys!
